TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AdornerDecorator extends System.Windows.Controls.Decorator

Docs.summary: Provides an for the child elements in the visual tree.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> can contain only one child element. That element can contain multiple elements that can be adorned.
The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> specifies the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer> in the visual tree. It is typically used in a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> for a control that might host <xref:System.Windows.Documents.Adorner> objects. For example, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> of a <xref:System.Windows.Window> contains an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> so that the child elements of the window can be adorned. The <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerLayer.GetAdornerLayer%2A> method returns `null` if you pass in an element that does not have an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> as an ancestor in its visual tree.
For more information about adorners and visual trees, see [Adorners Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/adorners-overview.md) and [Trees in WPF](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/trees-in-wpf.md).
## Examples The following example creates a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> for a <xref:System.Windows.Window>. The example adds a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ContentPresenter> as the child element of an <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator>. The logical child elements of the window can be adorned because the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> is in their visual tree.
[!code-xaml[ControlTemplateExamples#Window](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/ControlTemplateExamples/CS/resources/window.xaml#window)]

Docs.exception: An attempt is made to add more than a single child to the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks An <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator> can contain only one child, which is the parent element for the visual tree below the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.AdornerDecorator>.
